newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - DLJ ups KLA Instruments.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - DLJ ups KLA Instruments.

text.p: -- Donaldson Lufkin & Jenrette analyst Robert Maire said he raised KLA Instruments Corp to buy from market perform.
-- The analyst said he raised his earnings estimates for the fiscal year ending June 1997 to $1.75 from $1.66 per share previously and for fiscal 1998 to $2.25 from $2.00 per share.
-- He said he has a 12-month target price of $50 on the stock.
-- In published comments, the analyst said he believed KLA to have a more positive view of the future than the rest of the semiconductor equipment industry.
-- In particular, he noted that fabrication equipment makers like Applied Materials Inc, Lam Research Corp and Novellus Systems Inc are likely to continue to have weak results for several quarters.

-- "Though quarterly results were a penny light, it would appear that we may be back on track for sequential increases," Maire said of KLA's fiscal second quarter earnings report of $0.40 a share, or $0.01 below Maire's $0.41 estimate.
